title: Calories in Chicken Tenderloin
meta_description: Learn calories in tenderloin chicken per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition facts for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken tenderloin, cooked (grilled or baked), no added oil, salt, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked chicken tenderloin provides ~165 kcal and ~31g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g
Breaded and fried (vs. grilled) per 100 g
Marinated in 1 tbsp soy sauce per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g tenderloin chicken?
faqs.a: About 165 kcal for 100g cooked, skinless chicken tenderloin.

faqs.q: What's the protein in chicken tenderloin?
Is chicken tenderloin low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~3.6g total fat per 100g, with 1g saturated.

faqs.q: Calories in raw vs cooked tenderloin chicken?
faqs.a: Raw is ~110 kcal per 100g; cooking reduces weight but concentrates nutrients to ~165 kcal.

faqs.q: How does tenderloin chicken compare to breast?
faqs.a: Very similarâ€”both ~165 kcal and 31g protein per 100g cooked, skinless.
